question.title: How can I place jbutton over a jlabel with image?

node.contents: An example is shown **[here](http://stackoverflow.com/questions/19198298/show-button-on-jlabel-in-swing/19198871#19198871)**. You should choose a proper layout manager based on your needs.

astNode.text: An example is shown **[here](http://stackoverflow.com/questions/19198298/show-button-on-jlabel-in-swing/19198871#19198871)**. You should choose a proper layout manager based on your needs.

node.contents: You can create a JButton with an image, so what is the JLabel doing for you?

astNode.text: You can create a JButton with an image, so what is the JLabel doing for you?

node.contents: So, what are you really trying to accomplish here? Layering components isn't that easy in Swing. For more information, see [How to Use Layered Panes](http://docs.oracle.com/javase/tutorial/uiswing/components/layeredpane.html).

astNode.text: So, what are you really trying to accomplish here? Layering components isn't that easy in Swing. For more information, see [How to Use Layered Panes](http://docs.oracle.com/javase/tutorial/uiswing/components/layeredpane.html).

node.contents: **first**, show us what you have tried, **second** Make an image depicting your requirement, upload it to some image hosting site and link it in your question.

astNode.text: **first**, show us what you have tried, **second** Make an image depicting your requirement, upload it to some image hosting site and link it in your question.

node.contents: Im using JLayeredPane if you wanna keep it simple :)

astNode.text: Im using JLayeredPane if you wanna keep it simple :)

node.contents: I use netbeans IDE to create an application using java.I want to include a jbutton over a Jlabel with image.Actually when I add Jbutton over the Jlabel it would inserted but it will transparent and the name and the button didn't display.It seems the button to be added under the Jlabel.How can I overcome this proble?

astNode.text: I use netbeans IDE to create an application using java.I want to include a jbutton over a Jlabel with image.Actually when I add Jbutton over the Jlabel it would inserted but it will transparent and the name and the button didn't display.It seems the button to be added under the Jlabel.How can I overcome this proble?

node.contents: +1 for suggestions. I think the problem OP is facing is about missing `JLabel`'s layout manager.

astNode.text: +1 for suggestions. I think the problem OP is facing is about missing `JLabel`'s layout manager.

node.contents:
1. put image to JPanel by override paintComponent (standard way)

  2. JLabel haven't any LayoutManager in API, you have to set LayoutManager, then JLabel will be container

astNode.text:
1. put image to JPanel by override paintComponent (standard way)

  2. JLabel haven't any LayoutManager in API, you have to set LayoutManager, then JLabel will be container

elements.contents: ImageIcon img = null; class Panel extends JPanel{ @Override protected void paintComponent(Graphics g) { super.paintComponent(g); if (img == null){ img = new ImageIcon("d:\\picture.jpg"); g.drawImage(img.getImage(), 0, 0, null); } } } //in the constructor JButton button = new JButton( "OK"); Panel panel = new Panel(); panel.add(button); add(panel);

comments.text: //in the constructor JButton button = new JButton( "OK"); Panel panel = new Panel(); panel.add(button); add(panel);
